free_text.Learning outcomes: [b]Objectives Bioprocesses[/b][br/][li] Understand and apply the principles of fermentative bioprocesses using micro-organisms and mammalian cells[br/][li] Be able to plan, maintain and understand the different ways of performing microbial and mammalian cell fermentations in bioreactors [br/][li] Master the methods for the determination of the most important kinetic parameters[br/][br/][br/][br/][b] Objectives Downstream processing (DSP)[/b][br/][li] Understand the principles of the most common separation techniques for biotechnological products[br/][li] Select the best-suited strategy for the isolation of a fermentation or biotransformation product[br/]
free_text.Content: [b]Contents Bioprocesses (K. Eyer)[/b][br/][li] Bioreactors design and characterization[br/][li] Feeding strategies[br/][li] Process kinetics[br/][li] Cell growth kinetics in batch, fed-batch and continuous modes[br/][li] Determination of yields and productivity[br/]	[br/][br/][br/][b]Contents DSP (S. Crelier)[/b][br/][li] Characterization of the mixtures containing the target molecule[br/][li] Physical and thermal separation techniques[br/][li] Capture step(s)[br/][li] Purification step(s)[br/][li] Polishing step(s)
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic knowledge in microbiology and process engineering would be helpful. (a short list of recommended readings can be made available if desired)
